column5: Thanks for pinning the perch derby.  Here are a few pics from it.     We had a small scare to start the derby.  One of the boats was taking on water and cap sized in the harbour.  The anglers livewell was taking on water from a plug in it that failed.  Fortunately everyone was okay, really cold but okay.  (pictures to come this week).  The winning perch was a hair under a pound.  A real nice fish Richard managed to land from shore.    In the child division D.J. caught a shore fished perch that landed him in first place.      Another highlight of the day was a rainbow a local Hamilton angler landed in the corner of the boat launch.  Beautiful looking fish.       Thanks Guys.
Looked like a great day Greg, nice turn out. Sorry I couldn't make the event.
nice turnout for sure!  I'm surprised 1 of the guys off the board didn't end up going - its right in his neighborhood!
LoL! Hardly.... Was talking about "FishinFanatic69"... or whatever new alias he's using now. I've fished with him before... plus, he told me he lives in Hamilton.
ooh yes steer clear of this fishnlunatic guy bit nuts so! no seriously I disdain large crowds..but the derby looks like alot of fun!   I have to invite you down to fish rob Hamilton Bay is beautiful!
